title: Feminist Facts1: Interview Strategies and Political Subjects in Ethnography
affiliation: 1 Assistant professor in the School of Communications at The Pennsylvania State University, University Park, PA 16801. This analysis draws upon dissertation research supported by a fellowship from the Annenberg School for Communication, University of Pennsylvania, Philadelphia. Portions were presented at the 39th and 41st Annual Conferences of the International Communication Association, sessions of Philosophy of Communication Division (New Orleans, 1989) and Feminist Scholarship Interest Group (Chicago, 1991), respectively. Janice Radway's insights as discussant of the 1989 presentation have been invaluable. Lisa Henderson has reviewed the manuscript several times, to its substantial improvement. Others whose comments are much appreciated: Nina Gregg, Larry Gross, Leola Johnson, lanet Keefer, Pamela Sankar, Angharad Valdivia, and anonymous reviewers
